Method Detail

convertCheckEncoding

public static char[] convertCheckEncoding(java.io.InputStream input,
                                          java.lang.String inputEnc,
                                          java.lang.String outputEnc,
                                          boolean printErrors,
                                          boolean stopOnError)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Checks whether 1) the given input stream can be interpreted using the given input encoding and 2) can then be written using the given output encoding. Thus there are two cases where errors can be encoutered: at reading, when the raw data does not correspond to a valid character in this encoding ; and at writing, when a character can not be converted in the output encoding.

Parameters:
input - the input stream
inputEnc - the input charset encoding name
outputEnc - the output charset encoding name
printErrors - set to true if errors should be printed to stdout
stopOnError - set to true to stop as soon as an error happens.
Returns:
null if no error happens, and an array containing the invalid characters found when writing. This array may be empty in case errors happened only when reading.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when it is NOT a character coding error.

convertCheckEncoding

public static char[] convertCheckEncoding(java.io.InputStream input,
                                          java.lang.String inputEnc,
                                          boolean printErrors,
                                          boolean stopOnError)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Checks whether a text file can be written in a given charset encoding. If no charset is provided the default encoding is used.

Parameters:
args - Parameters syntax: <filename> [encoding]
